result.execSummary:
The defendant Haley M Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:30 p.m. Defendant Haley M Hintz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
 
15CM175:  43 days jail w/43 days credit - time served, Pay costs.
15CF221: I/S Sentence: 150 days jail w/huber - no credit - Stayed
18 mo Probation with Conditions stated on the record.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM175 and 15CF221 Ct 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
  15CF221 Counts 2 & 3 are Dismissed and Read In.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT: *****PROBATION***
15CF221: Count 1: I/S Sentence: 150 days jail w/huber or electronic monitor, if eligible - no credit - Stayed
18 mo Probation
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Pay costs.
No conditional jail.
Early discharge upon recommendation of the Agent and Expungement option of 15CF221.

15CM175:  43 days jail w/43 days credit - time served, Pay costs.

Appeal rights provided.

Defendant Haley M Hintz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

State recommends the bond 15CM175 $500 cash bond was ordered with conditions be applied to this case as well.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Bond amended to include that it now covers 15CM175 & 15CF221.

ADDRESS INFO for Haley M Hintz
Current: 3001 Minnesota Avenue, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2015)
Prior: 2701 Forest Drive #98, Plover, WI 54467

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Ryan Drengler appeared by video for Defendant Haley M Hintz. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Ryan Drengler in court for Defendant Haley M Hintz.    Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.  P/NG entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Resisting/Obstructing an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5-11-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
